title: Identical Location Electron Microscopy Study of Cu Electrocatalyst
content: To overcome the material gap in relating the reconstructed structure of catalysts during the reaction to their catalytic performance, there are basically two solutions to this problem: In-situ electron microscopy (In-situ EM) and Identical location electron microscopy (IL-EM). In-situ EM is a high-end technique to dynamically study the catalysts under reaction condition, which is enabled by Gas cell holder and Liquid cell holder equipped with an electron microscope. The liquid cell holder integrated with biased electrodes are used to study electrocatalysts for CO2RR in recent years [1]. This technique allows the observation of catalysts at electrolyte-electrode interface but still suffers from the limited spatial resolution [2].
